page.title: 01EDUCATION- PRIMARY NORTHOP.
page.content: Northop County Primary School was opened in 1975. There are about 78 pupils and 4 teachers.The school has 4 classrooms and a kitchen. Attached to the school is a County Library branch which is open twice a week. The pupils begin school at the age of four and leave when they are eleven. School starts at 9.00am, the juniors finish at 3.20pm and the infants finish at 3 o'clock.The lessons are about one hour long and consist of Art, Environmental Studies, Mathematics,Comprehension,Reading,P.E and sometimes Welsh.In each class there are about 22 pupils.Classes are decided upon the ability of the children instead of age. When the new school was opened it was named "Ysgol Owen Jones" after a baby found in the Bellfry of Saint Peter's Church.
